questions.question: The universal sign of fear that appears in less than 1/5 of a second is:
choices: Wide-open eyes with raised upper eyelids

questions.question: True anger almost always includes:
choices: Eyebrows raised and pulled together + lowered stare
Eyebrows lowered and pulled together + hard stare

questions.question: A genuine (Duchenne) smile always involves:
choices: Mouth + raised cheeks + crow’s feet around eyes
Just crow’s feet, no mouth movement

questions.question: Contempt is the only emotion that shows asymmetrically. You spot it when someone:
choices: Tightens and raises one corner of the mouth only

questions.question: A quick flash of raised eyebrows + wide eyes usually means:
choices: Surprise (even if they quickly hide it)

questions.question: When someone says “I’m fine” but you see a microexpression of:
choices: All of the above can mean they’re NOT fine

questions.question: Disgust is reliably shown by:
choices: Upper lip raised + nose wrinkle + squinted eyes

questions.question: Sadness microexpressions usually include:
choices: Inner eyebrows raised + mouth corners down + lip tremble

questions.question: You see a quick lip press (lips disappear) right after someone smiles. This often signals:
choices: They’re controlling or suppressing negative emotion

questions.question: A reliable “tell” that someone is lying or hiding something is:
choices: Microexpression that doesn’t match their words (incongruence)

score.high: Microexpression Master  You read faces like an FBI profiler—nothing gets past you!
score.medium: Sharp Observer  You catch most leaks and tells; just a little more practice and you’re elite.
score.low: Human Polygraph in Training  You’re learning! Faces are tough—keep studying and you’ll get scary good.
